meanings.definition: To pass or diffuse through a semipermeable membrane.
meanings.sent1: Water can osmose through the membrane.
meanings.sent2: The dye will osmose into the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The flavors seemed to osmose together in the stew.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness osmosed into every aspect of her life.
meanings.sent5: The music osmosed into every corner of the room, filling it with melody.

meanings.definition: To gradually or subtly permeate or be absorbed.
meanings.sent1: The aroma began to osmose through the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The news will osmose through the community slowly.
meanings.sent3: The feeling of excitement seemed to osmose from person to person.
meanings.sent4: His words osmosed into her heart, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the sun osmosed into her skin, making her feel cozy.
